alert.note: Alert for Hawaii in Hawaii (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 18 at 5:14AM HST until February 18 at 7:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM HST THIS MORNING FOR THE ISLAND OF HAWAII IN HAWAII COUNTY... At 514 AM HST, radar indicated heavy rain over all of windward Big Island. Persistent heavy rainfall continues over the Kau and Puna Districts, with very heavy rain also affecting the Hilo and Hamakua Districts. Rain was falling at a rate of 2 to 3 inches per hour in the heaviest showers. Flash flooding is ongoing in Kau, where Highway 11 remains closed near Kawa Flats. Hawaii County Civil Defense Agency also reports Highway 19 is closed near mile marker 13 in Honomu due to debris on the roadway. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hilo, Hawaiian Paradise Park, Honokaa, Volcano, Glenwood, Hawaii Volcanoes National Park, Mountain View, Wood Valley, Hawaiian Acres, Pohakuloa Training Area, Pohakuloa Camp, Keaau, Orchidland Estates, Pahala, Papaikou, Pepeekeo, Pahoa, Punaluu Beach and Honomu. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry.
